variant.question:
Which of these statements about composite and metal structures are correct or incorrect?

I. In composite structural components, the tensile strength is the same in all directions independent of the direction of the fibres.   
 II. Metals structures are chosen preferably to achieve structures with higher strength-to-weight ratio than composite materials.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about composite and metal structures are correct or incorrect?

I. In composite structural components, the tensile strength is the same in all directions independent of the direction of the fibres.   
II. Composite materials enable manufacturing structures with a higher strength-to-weight ratio than metal structures.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
